text.#text: Not later than January 30 of each year, the
Each Report shall include the following:

An estimate, for the fiscal year during which the Report is submitted and for the preceding fiscal
			 year, of each of the following:
The regulatory costs imposed by each Executive branch agency on regulated entities.
The aggregate costs imposed by each Executive branch agency.
The aggregate costs imposed by all Executive branch agencies combined.

The direct costs incurred by the Federal Government because of covered Federal rules issued by each
			 Executive branch agency.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and

			 organizations, and small governmental jurisdictions (as those terms are

The sum of the costs described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: since the previous annual report.

text.#text: An analysis of any major changes in estimation methodology used by the

An analysis of any major estimate changes caused by improved or inadequate data since the previous
			 annual report.
Recommendations, both general and specific, regarding the following:
How regulations may be streamlined, simplified, and modernized.
Regulations that should be repealed.

How the Federal Government may reduce the costs of regulations without diminishing the
			 effectiveness of regulations.

text.#text: The

An Executive branch agency that exceeds the annual agency regulatory cost cap imposed by the
			 National Regulatory Budget for a fiscal year may not promulgate a new
			 covered Federal rule that increases regulatory costs until the Executive
			 branch agency no longer exceeds the annual agency regulatory cost cap
			 imposed by the applicable National Regulatory Budget.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Effect of violation of this section

text.#text:
A covered Federal rule that is promulgated in violation of this section shall have no force or
			 effect.

Any party may bring an action in a district court of the United States to declare that a covered
			 Federal rule has no force or effect because the covered Federal rule was
			 promulgated in violation of this section.
